qas.question: Which artists in the early 19th and 20th century inspired by the newly discovered African, Native American, Micro and Polynesian art?

answers.text: Paul Gauguin, Henri Matisse, and Pablo Picasso

qas.question: What about the Native cultures art inspired Matisse, Picasso, and Gauguin?
Who did Picasso meet around 1906 that had also recenelty learned about Primitivism?
What were Picasso's 1907 paintings usually characterized by?

plausible_answers.text: Paul Gauguin, Henri Matisse, and Pablo Picasso

qas.question: Which artists in the early 21st century inspired by the newly discovered African, Native American, Micro and Polynesian art?
What about the Native cultures art did not inspire Matisse, Picasso, and Gauguin?
Who did Picasso meet around 1960 that had also recently learned about Primitivism?
What were Picasso's 1970 paintings usually characterized by?

context: During the late 19th and early 20th centuries, Europeans were discovering African, Polynesian, Micronesian and Native American art. Artists such as <a0_0><b4_0>Paul Gauguin, Henri Matisse, and Pablo Picasso<b4_0/><a0_0/> were intrigued and inspired by the <a1_0><b5_0>stark power and simplicity<b5_0/><a1_0/> of styles of those foreign cultures. Around 1906, Picasso met Matisse through <a2_0><b6_0>Gertrude Stein<b6_0/>,<a2_0/> at a time when both artists had recently acquired an interest in primitivism, Iberian sculpture, African art and African tribal masks. They became friendly rivals and competed with each other throughout their careers, perhaps leading to Picasso entering a new period in his work by 1907, marked by the influence of Greek, Iberian and African art. Picasso's paintings of 1907 have been characterized as <a3_0><b7_0>Protocubism<b7_0/><a3_0/>, as notably seen in Les Demoiselles d'Avignon, the antecedent of Cubism.
